comment: Professor Wachtman was great! This is an easy class, and once you hit your 90+ points for an A, you do not have to complete the rest of the semester. That is your final grade. Highly recommend.

She was a good professor. This class was really easy you only have to do 4 discussion post and the major project: a 2-page paper museum report. If you do any of the other assignments, then they count as extra credit and there are 3 tests that last one is options if you are satisfied with your grade in class possible to finish class early
great teacher, super easy class. 10/10

Always make sure to do your discussions, turn in your assignments, and in case you want to get more points, there is the opportunity for extra credit. There are 3 tests for the entire semester but you should be able to get a decent grade on it. May seem like an easy online course but always make sure to not fall too behind or you won't do well.
Great professor! She really encourages her students to become interested in art. I loved how clear and precise she was in regards to what she wanted!

We were her first online class and I recommend taking this in person. there is more work in the online class and her tone can come off as rude in the emails sometimes. Group projects are harder because if you split the project into parts and someone does their part wrong, EVERYONE gets the bad grade. Just take in person. It's only a 2 hour class.
Good easy A. Nice old lady that is passionate about teaching. Do your work and go to class to make an A. Hour lecture and craft at every class. Take her.
Fun and easy class. Follow the rubrics and you'll get an A.

I really liked this class! Art project every class, but they are fun. 2 group projects (paper & lesson plan)Portfolio that consisted of art projects. She can be a bit talkative at times but she's sweet and helpful! She knows her stuff! oh yea, buy the book (we use it) AND keep it (great ideas for your future classroom) Easy A, Take her!!

I loved this class! She was very good about connecting art to other areas of education. There's usually a project every day and they are FUN! You don't have to be an artist, A for effort. Lots of group work so make sure you like where you sit, because that's your group for the rest of the semester! Great teacher, would definitely recommend!

Stereotypical art teacher. I liked her and the way she did things but I can see why some people wouldn't. She gives you credit for trying, artistic ability is not relevant. Lots of connections to other disciplines which I liked a lot.
Crazy old BAT! She is verbally abusive if you're not artistic. Has a lot of assignments but is overall an easy grader.
WONDERFUL CLASS! Clear about what she wants. Everything we did in this class will be helpful in profession. She is very sweet and very understanding! EASY A and very worth your time!

Great teacher! Easy A but this class was more work than I thought it would be (for an art class).  Art Gallery Report, Papers and Group Project all to be completed outside of class. They are not hard just busy work! You do art projects every day in class and she grades you on your effort! Definitely take her! She is a really great teacher!

Very easy class.  Fun art projects in every class, one outside observation in an art gallery and one group powerpoint presentation.  Fun teacher who enjoys her work.  Definitely take her if you can.  Easy, fun A!

LOTS of work, however, well worth it!  Prof.Wachtman is such a sweetheart.  It really is impossible to make a B in her class, unless you just don't show up.  Thoroughly enjoyed her class, she is always trying to make you laugh & have fun.  She definitely loves art. She made the class a great experience.  If you can take her I recommend her!
I took this class during the summer and loved it. Professor Wachtman really knows her art stuff. We did a lot of projects but they were simple. She even tells you its hard to make a B in her class.

Good prof for a required class! Class was interesting because she enjoys her job. Tests were pretty easy, easy A with a little bit of studying. Keep up with the easy in class mini-projects and you'll come out with a grade that will keep your GPA where you want it!

this class was art history...a breeze. she was great-this isn't for uptight people. we colored and put lil hands on art projects together each class. her notes were extremely helpful. she is a lot of fun.

Disorganized. Confused. Elementary (crayons, cutting and pasting). Attend four arts events. Memorize definitions. This is for kids that grew up in a barrel. Insulting if youâ€™ve got an ounce of art appreciation or talent. This is more a criticism of KSU than the prof. This is elementary school art, not university level.
she is a little dis organized but she goes over the test before she gives it to you, so you know what the questions are, attend class and it will be easier!
She was a little loopy and very disorganized about notes, which makes the tests a little more difficult.  She does not curve, but she gives extra credit if you ask.
